summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting a telephonic interview conducted on October 11, 2021, with an unnamed female witness. The witness describes her work for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, including receiving cash payments, performing various tasks, and Maxwell's specific instructions for recruiting young, pretty girls from a ballet school, aged 14-15, for secretarial work.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The witness worked for him; she sometimes massaged him or received a massage from him as part of her duties.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Hired and paid the witness in cash, gave her daily instructions, and specified criteria for recruiting young girls from a ballet school, preferring ages 14-15.

persons.name: Ben Affleck
persons.context: Mentioned in a joke by Maxwell, who told the witness not to steal his phone number while shredding books.

connections.description: Both were employers of the witness, with Maxwell giving instructions related to work for Epstein.
Maxwell hired, paid in cash, and gave daily work instructions to the witness.
The witness performed work for Epstein, including massaging him.

events.title: FBI Telephonic Interview of Witness
events.description: An unnamed female witness was interviewed telephonically by the FBI regarding her work for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell explicitly instructed the witness to recruit girls aged 14-15 from a ballet school, stating that age range was 'better'.
Maxwell specified recruitment criteria: girls must be 'pretty', not have boyfriends, want money, and be willing to do secretarial work.
The witness's duties for Epstein and Maxwell varied daily and included answering phones, shredding books, and giving/receiving massages.
Maxwell paid the witness in cash, typically more than $200 per hour, at the end of the work day.
